page.title: 06Ralston Farm.
page.content: Ralston is on the Newtyle to Meigle road just over half a mile north of Newtyle.The farm has 210 acres including 13 acres of{mixed woodland. The woodland is sometimes used for shooting.Mr.John Burnett is the farmer and he employs 5 workers. He owns 30 bullocks and 20 heifers which he buys in to fatten with{hay, {silage and turnips.}These are fodder crops. Half his land is under{barley}and he also grows a little{oats}and {oilseed rape}all of which he sells. He has 2 fields of{peas}which are harvested by the contractor. Mr.Burnett specialises in the growing of{daffodils.}Many women are employed to gather the{flowers}in the spring and skin the{bulbs}in the summer.The flower fields are a pretty sight in April. (Shirley Dallas P7)
